content.question: NATIONAL CAPITAL TERRITORY OF DELHI, INDIA, POPULATION CHANGE Census Year 1991 2001 2011 Total population 9,420,644 13,850,507 16,787,941 Population density per square mile 17,771 26,128 31,669 COMMUTERS IN DELHI, INDIA © Hindustan Times / Contributor The National Capital Territory of Delhi, India, includes the old city of Delhi; the national capital city of New Delhi; and surrounding districts, where much of the city’s population resides. Using the data in the table, describe how Delhi is classified as a megacity. Describe a pull factor that has contributed to Delhi’s total population change over time. Explain how local housing development has contributed to the change in Delhi’s population density, as shown in the data table. Given Delhi’s population density, describe a challenge related to urban infrastructure that the city’s government is likely to face. Explain the challenge to Delhi’s local environmental sustainability that is shown in the photograph. Explain the degree to which India’s level of economic development as a country contributes to Delhi’s local challenges to environmental sustainability. Explain a possible solution to the challenge of environmental sustainability that is shown in the photograph.
